CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 27 In chlorobenzene ( CB ) solution , PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm and a slightly weaker peak at 433 nm ; when changing the branched 2ethylhexyl to linear hexyl side chain , the resulted polymer PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm , respectively , which may due to the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph! Here are the entities I found:

1. Chlorobenzene (CB) - This is a chemical compound mentioned in the paragraph as the solvent in which the PIDT and PIDT-EHNT polymers were dissolved.
2. PIDT - This is a polymer mentioned in the paragraph, which stands for "Poly(2-iodo-5-diphenyl-1,3,4-thiadiazole)."
3. PIDT-EHNT - This is a modified version of the PIDT polymer, where the "EHNT" suffix stands for "ethyl hexyl nitrate."
4. DTNT - This is another modified version of the PIDT polymer, where the "DTNT" suffix stands for "dodecyl thiol."

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. Chlorobenzene (CB) - This is the solvent in which the PIDT and PIDT-EHNT polymers were dissolved.
2. PIDT - This is the polymer material whose absorption spectrum was measured in the paragraph.
3. PIDT-EHNT - This is a modified version of the PIDT polymer with an ethyl hexyl nitrate side chain.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Chlorobenzene (CB) |
| PIDT |
| PIDT-EHNT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Paragraph: 27 In chlorobenzene ( CB ) solution , PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm and a slightly weaker peak at 433 nm ; when changing the branched 2ethylhexyl to linear hexyl side chain , the resulted polymer PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm , respectively , which may due to the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PIDT: This is a property name, as it is a abbreviation for a specific compound or material.
2. EHNT: This is also a property name, as it is an abbreviation for a specific compound or material.
3. DTNT: This is a property name, as it is an abbreviation for a specific compound or material.
4. CB: This is a property name, as it is an abbreviation for a specific compound or material (chlorobenzene).

So, the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are: PIDT, EHNT, DTNT, and CB.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Property in the paragraph:

2. DTNT: This is a property name that refers to a specific material property.

So, the Material Property entities in the paragraph are:

1. PIDT
2. DTNT

Certainly! Here are the valid Material Property entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| --- |

| DTNT |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 27 In chlorobenzene ( CB ) solution , PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm and a slightly weaker peak at 433 nm ; when changing the branched 2ethylhexyl to linear hexyl side chain , the resulted polymer PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm , respectively , which may due to the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain.

Let's think step by step.

In this paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

1. Absorption maximum: This is the wavelength at which the molecule absorbs light, which is mentioned in the paragraph as 599 nm and 433 nm.
2. Peak: This refers to the position of the absorption maximum, which is mentioned as 608 nm and 439 nm in the paragraph.
3. Steric hindrance: This is a property of the molecule that refers to the obstruction of the movement of other molecules due to the bulkiness of the molecule. The paragraph suggests that the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain may cause a bathochromic shift of the absorption peaks.

So, the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

1. Absorption maximum
2. Peak
3. Steric hindrance
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph:

1. Absorption maximum: This is the wavelength at which the molecule absorbs light, which is mentioned as 599 nm and 433 nm.
2. Peak: This refers to the position of the absorption maximum, which is mentioned as 608 nm and 439 nm.

So, the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph are:

1. Absorption maximum
2. Peak

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Absorption maximum (599 nm and 433 nm) |
| Peak (608 nm and 439 nm) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
